action.action-desc: Mr. Waxman (for himself, Ms. Brownley of California, and Mr. Schiff) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Veterans’ Affairs

form.official-title: To authorize the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to enter into enhanced-use leases for certain buildings of the Department of Veterans Affairs at the West Los Angeles Medical Center, California.

section.header: Authority to enter into enhanced-use leases for certain buildings of the Department of Veterans Affairs at the West Los Angeles Medical Center, California

paragraph.text: Except as provided by subsection (b), in accordance with subchapter V of chapter 81 of title 38, United States Code, the Secretary of Veterans Affairs may enter into an enhanced-use lease for a covered building for the provision of long-term therapeutic housing for covered veterans.
The authority provided by paragraph (1) is a specific authorization for purposes of section 8162(c) of such title.

subsection.header: Prohibition on disposition of leased property

paragraph.text: In accordance with section 224(a) of the Military Construction and Veterans Affairs and Related Agencies Appropriations Act, 2008 (division I of Public Law 110–161; 121 Stat. 2272), section 8164 of title 38, United States Code, shall not apply to a covered building.
Nothing in this section shall be construed to affect the prohibition under such section 224(a) on the disposal of a covered building.

Not less than once during each two-year period in which an enhanced-use lease is in effect under subsection (a), the Secretary of Veterans Affairs shall conduct a review of such lease, including by assessing the party that is entered into such lease and determining whether such lease should continue.
During each two-year period in which an enhanced-use lease is in effect under subsection (a), the Secretary shall submit to Congress a report on the review conducted under paragraph (1).
The term covered building means any of the following buildings located at the West Los Angeles Medical Center, California:
The term covered veteran means a veteran who is—

subparagraph.text: with respect to housing, requires assisted living or other similar form of care.

paragraph.text: The term enhanced-use lease has the meaning given that term in section 8161 of title 38, United States Code.

The term long-term therapeutic housing means supportive housing consisting of clinically supportive living facilities that provide housing to a homeless veteran for a period that is sufficient for the veteran to achieve stability and require a lower level of care than is provided at such facilities.
